description: This rare early performance from Philadelphia's Comedy Factory Outlet takes you back to Andrew Dice Clay's roots as the original "hoodlum of humor" with a look at the early career of this groundbreaking, hardcore comic.
name: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice

original_info.id: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night With Dice_2003
original_info.name: Andrew Dice Clay: One Night With Dice

review.name: Before the Diceman Cometh
review.reviewBody: Before the famous 1989 comedy special The Diceman Cometh, Andrew Dice Clay wasn't as famous as he was then or now. But this proves that he was funny back then. Only problem, it seems as if this special is just The Diceman cometh as a experiment. But still, it is great (and funny) entertainment where we would first hear the mother goose poems and impressions (instead of Eric Roberts he does Jerry lewis). Great material, very topical, that shaped diec's career as a comedian. A+
